events.desc: Fired when the content has been scrolled.

jsdoc.description: Fired when the content has been scrolled.
jsdoc.orig:
*
     * Fired when the content has been scrolled.
     *
     * @event content-scroll

events.name: content-scroll

events.desc: Fired when the header is transformed.

jsdoc.description: Fired when the header is transformed.
jsdoc.orig:
*
     * Fired when the header is transformed.
     *
     * @event paper-header-transform

events.name: paper-header-transform

properties.name: HEADER_STATE_CONDENSED
properties.desc: The header's state when it's condensed.

properties.name: HEADER_STATE_EXPANDED
properties.desc: The header's initial state

properties.name: HEADER_STATE_HIDDEN
properties.desc: The header's state when it's hidden.

properties.name: HEADER_STATE_INTERPOLATED
properties.desc:
The header's state when its progress is somewhere between
the `hidden` and `condensed` state.

properties.name: assignParentResizable
properties.desc:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

properties.name: condense
properties.desc: Condense the header.

params.name: smooth
params.desc: true if the scroll position should be smoothly adjusted.

properties.name: condensedHeaderHeight
properties.desc:
The height of the header when it is condensed.

By default, `condensedHeaderHeight` is 1/3 of `headerHeight` unless
this is specified.

properties.name: condenses
properties.desc:
If true, the header's height will condense to `condensedHeaderHeight`
as the user scrolls down from the top of the content area.

properties.name: content
properties.desc: Returns the content element.

properties.name: fixed
properties.desc: If true, the header is fixed to the top and never moves away.

properties.name: header
properties.desc: Returns the header element.

properties.name: headerHeight
properties.desc:
The height of the header when it is at its full size.

By default, the height will be measured when it is ready.  If the height
changes later the user needs to either set this value to reflect the
new height or invoke `measureHeaderHeight()`.

properties.name: headerState
properties.desc:
The state of the header. The initial value is `HEADER_STATE_EXPANDED`.
Depending on the configuration and the `scrollTop` value,
the header state could change to
`HEADER_STATE_HIDDEN`, `HEADER_STATE_CONDENSED` and `HEADER_STATE_INTERPOLATED`

properties.name: keepCondensedHeader
properties.desc: If true, the condensed header is always shown and does not move away.

properties.name: measureHeaderHeight
properties.desc:
Invoke this to tell `paper-scroll-header-panel` to re-measure the header's
height.

properties.name: noDissolve
properties.desc: If true, no cross-fade transition from one background to another.

properties.name: noReveal
properties.desc: If true, the header doesn't slide back in when scrolling back up.

properties.name: notifyResize
properties.desc:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

properties.name: resizerShouldNotify
properties.desc:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.desc:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

properties.name: scroll
properties.desc: Scroll to a specific y coordinate.

params.name: top
params.desc: The coordinate to scroll to, along the y-axis.

params.name: smooth
params.desc: true if the scroll position should be smoothly adjusted.

properties.name: scrollAwayTopbar
properties.desc:
By default, the top part of the header stays when the header is being
condensed.  Set this to true if you want the top part of the header
to be scrolled away.

properties.name: scrollToTop
properties.desc: Scroll to the top of the content.

params.name: smooth
params.desc: true if the scroll position should be smoothly adjusted.

properties.name: scroller
properties.desc: Returns the scrollable element.

properties.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
properties.desc:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.desc:
True if this element is currently notifying its descedant elements of
resize.

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.desc: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

events.desc: Fired when the content has been scrolled.

jsdoc.description: Fired when the content has been scrolled.
jsdoc.orig:
*
     * Fired when the content has been scrolled.
     *
     * @event content-scroll

events.name: content-scroll

events.desc: Fired when the header is transformed.
